results.text: A karate kick to the head. A swift kick after a normal attack dealing an additional [[1D6]] damage.
The Judo Chop from Hell. After the normal attack, the Night Stalker follows up with a blow to the neck region of his target dealing [[1D6]] damage and knocking them unconscious.
Slice and Dice. Throw a well-placed ninja star after a normal attack. The ninja star deals normal damage. Grants the Night Stalker an additional +2 to their Attitude score.

Shuriken Madness! In addition to the attack, the Night Stalker throws 3 ninja throwing stars at a target other than the original target. These stars auto-hit. If only one target is available, the 3 ninja stars hit the original target.

Fear of the Dark. Hiding in the shadows, the Night Stalker waits for the perfect time to strike—out of the dark, a flash of steel deals an additional +3 damage, and any other enemies that can see the attack roll on the Fear Table.

Lightning-fast reflexes enable the Night Stalker to deal additional damage with the weapon they are using. Roll a number of D6s equal to the Night Stalker’s Prowess S.T.A.T.S. Modifier and add the total to the damage.
Flying Dragon Punch. A blue spectral fist hits the target, dealing [[1D8]] damage on top of the normal attack.
Blood on the Blade. Through the carnage and bloodshed the Night Stalker is able to regain health equal to damage dealt this turn. In addition, the attack deals an additional +3 damage.
Extensive battle experience and the Art of Chuck unlocks the ability to cast Charm on a target the Night Stalker can see. This attack deals an additional +3 damage as well.
Fingers for Spears. In addition to the normal attack, the Night Stalker makes an unarmed strike with two fingers extended that deals [[2D6]] damage to the target.
Mirror Match. Splitting into two Night Stalkers, they both deal the same amount of damage to the target.

Ghost Assassin. Deep meditation in the art of Chuck causes the Night Stalker to become a vapor-walker (able to walk through walls and be undetected by normal vision) for [[1D4]] turns; each attack gains an additional +4 damage.
The true art of Chuck comes to the mind’s eye of the Night Stalker, granting them an additional attack this turn.
A barrage of kicks and punches follow up the attack, making the Night Stalker a true karate commando! [[1D10]] Attacks hit for 1D4 damage each.

No Surrender. The fight rages on and the only thing the Night Stalker needs is the sheer will and dedication to the art of Chuck to ensure a speedy victory. Harnessing battle meditation, the Night Stalker regains all lost Stealth Points.
Dragon blade technique. Art of an ancient dragon appears on your weapon of choice, granting the ability to deal an additional 1D6 damage with the said weapon until the Night Stalker takes damage.
Ninja Storm! Allies from the Night Stalker's Chuck Dojo come to aid them in the battle! [[1D6]] Night Stalkers attack from the shadows, each dealing 1D6 damage to the target.

Sudden Death. Masters of Chuck the Night Stalker can kill a target with one slice of the katana or a single ninja throwing star. The target makes a Death Saving Throw. If it is a success, they take normal damage +5. If they fail, they die instantly.
Time Stasis Meditation. Chuck speaks to the Night Stalker directly, showing them the true way and enabling them to take an additional turn after this one.
Shuriken Storm. In a flurry of attack, the Night Stalker throws an absurd amount of ninja stars in addition to the attack. [[5D20]]] Stars are tossed at the target at lightning-fast speed.
